Fund Purpose: To account for municipal activities not authorized or contemplated by special funds

Fund Purpose: Retains funding for unanticipated expenditures and revenue shortfalls in the General Fund
Sources of Funds: The City Council shall annually allocate not less than 2 and three-fourths percent of all General Fund receipts into the Emergency Reserve Account; all Reserve Fund monies over and above that amount shall be allocated to the Contingency Reserve Account
Eligible Uses: Shall include funding for unanticipated expenditures and revenue shortfalls in the City's General Fund. The Council shall by ordinance establish policies for the use of the Contingency Reserve Account; the Emergency Reserve Account shall require a two-thirds vote of the City Council with the concurrence of the Mayor in concurrence with a finding of urgent economic necessity

Fund Purpose: Records over budget savings when revenues are strong to protect services during revenue downturns

BSF funds can only be expended during fiscal years when actual revenues are less than projected revenue target at the time of budget adoption

By May 1st of each even numbered year, LADOT shall provide a proposal for the adjustment of fees for services, and shall provide a report and proposed draft ordinance to the Mayor/City Council detailing any requested changes in the fees for any service enumerated in this Section. Current indirect costs for labor from the City's cost allocation plan shall also be included as part of the adjustment and assessment report.
